question.body: You may expect vasodilation due to __________.

multiple_choice.choice: an increase in oxygen concentration in the tissue fluid
a decrease in CO2 in the tissue fluid
an increase in pH of the interstitial fluid
an increase in lactic acid concentration in skeletal muscles

response.feedback: Incorrect. If there is high oxygen, then there will not be a requirement for greater blood flow, which is the result of vasodilation.
Incorrect. If there is low CO2, then there will not be a requirement for greater blood flow, which is the result of vasodilation.
Incorrect. An increase in pH indicates lower CO2 in the tissue fluid. This means that blood flow need to be restricted to raise the CO2 level.

Correct. Increase in lactate means that there is demand for oxygen and fuel. Vasodilation increases the supply of nutrients and oxygen rich blood while at the same time enhancing the rate of waste removal -â€“ in this case lactate.

part.hint: Think about how blood vessels respond to changes in the properties of tissue fluid and cells being supplied.

question.body: People who experience local injury often take a prostaglandin inhibitor. This is because __________.

multiple_choice.choice: prostaglandins are local signaling molecules that cause inflammation, and inhibiting them decreases inflammation
prostaglandins inhibit inflammation, blocking them promotes the beneficial effects of inflammation.
prostaglandins inhibit blood flow to the area, inhibiting them increases blood flow, which benefits tissue healing
prostaglandins are releases locally but move to the central nervous system to cause pain. Inhibiting them blocks pain

response.feedback: Correct. Prostaglandins mediate many of the aspects of inflammation, including vasodilation and local pain.
Incorrect. Prostaglandins promote blood flow (possibly excessive) to an area.
Incorrect. Although prostaglandins can sensitize pain receptors, they do so locally and not by traveling to the CNS.

part.hint: Aspirin and ibuprofen are prostaglandin inhibitors.
